(13) API Products are Products

  • Products have consumers and should drive organizational value
  • API Products are a special kind of product with additional constraints
    • More a service than a (physical) product
    • Many APIs are not (directly) consumed by external consumers
    • API products are the parts for composing digital value chains

(26) What is Digital Transformation?

Digital Transformation means adapting an organization's strategy and structure to capture opportunities enabled by digital technology. (Nathan Furr and Andrew Shipilov, Digital Doesn't Have to Be Disruptive, Harvard Business Review 97(4), July/August 2019, pp. 94-103) [https://hbr.org/2019/07/digital-doesnt-have-to-be-disruptive]


Why APIs? Microproducts! Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(27) Goal #1: Flexibility

  • Build new products and services out of existing building blocks
  • Contribute new capabilities as building blocks to the platform
  • Improve solution space by making all capabilities available for reuse


Why APIs? Microproducts! Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way

(28) Goal #2: Velocity

  • Reduce coordination overhead by making capabilities readily consumable
  • Avoid duplication of effort by always exposing capabilities for reuse
  • Reduce the time needed for digital building block management


Why APIs? Microproducts! Erik Wilde (@dret): Making APIs the Default: Enabling Everybody to Think the API Way
